tags: None
review: Good doctor. He treated me with gentle care and gave me sufficient time. Overall experience was good.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
I shall name them Dr. Dynamic Duo. Yes, very much impressed with their coordination & management.
There are more reason why I am so much impressed by Dr. Naveen & Dr. Rajeev.
I had come to ‘Sports Orthopedics Institute’ with my 4 yrs old AC Joint dislocation injury. This place was my last stop or destination of my hunt to know what are the treatment options I could have, for last 4yrs. Ever since the injury happened, I had seen 4 supposedly best orthopedic surgeons of the town, 2 among them were even foreign return retd. Doctors, but couldn’t even tell me what has actually happened inside the skin at my left shoulder, why 1 of the bone end is bulging up and what should be done to it. One retd. Visiting doctor suggested me to undergo a month physiotherapy treatment (if I am not wrong then this works when issue is at rotator-cuff), however I got that done too very religiously (that costed me a bomb too), when the X-ray report had nothing about rotator-cuff.
I tried again after 4 yrs to see if I can find some better doctor online, who can tell me what are the treatment options available for my injury in our country. In the process, read few recommendation about Dr. Dynamic Duo and gave a last try after complete disappointment for the doctors of the town. But to my surprise, I found them coming down to the phone line just like any friend awaiting for your call for quite sometime. Welcome with such a bright smile on their faces. But the most important thing for me was they kind of understood how exactly I had the injury in gym. Unlike any other clinic or doctors, they both examined me separately and suggested me very frankly, what can be done & what %age of strength can be expected back in future. Also, they were kind enough to suggest me should I go for the surgery or not.
Even though this place is closely 30kms away from my place, now after meeting them I don’t know any other orthopedic surgeons in Bangalore city for any future consultations(God forbid).

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,
review: Doctor is good, he explains everything in details and doesn't recommended anything which is not required.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
******* *** **** ****** * **** **** ****** ** *****When I experienced foot drop and visited Dr Rajeev, he diligently took time to explain to me what possibly could have caused it and defined the course of action. Since I started experiencing the pain after a dance-fitness session, we first went forth with an X-Ray to look for possible fractures. Since the X-Ray didn't reveal any abnormalities, we went forth with an MRI to check for possible nerve damage. Meanwhile, I was able to move my fit a little more over the course of 3 days. When the MRI did not reveal any abnormalities either, he asked me if I had a tendency to cross my legs for too long. Turns out I had crossed my legs for too long and pinched the nerve which resulted in the foot drop. After a rest for about 3 weeks and some calcium and vitamin D supplements, I was good as new.
I have rarely come across such amazing doctors who take time to explain to the patient what could be wrong and how they'll go about fixing it. And that too doing it right! Needless to say, this guy is an absolute gem.

tags: None
review: We reached out doc twice so far for Knee pain & Shoulder pain. A thorough professional who explains about the test he is gonna conduct. He then gives top 3 reasons why this would happen, causes, and how can we get long term solution (physiotherapy, exercise, life style changes etc) & short term solutions like meds if pain is too much & pills for vitamin deficiency. He also shows you diagram & pictures so that you understand where has what gone wrong. He sends you PDF to read & follow instructions to exercise. All in all haven't met a better Ortho! We recommend him highly!

tags: None
review:
I visisted the doctor looking at the positive reviews on Practo and had an utterly satisfying experience.
The doctor was crisp in his queries and diagnosis,explained the issue well.** *********** **** ** *********** **** ********* *** didnt jump to start a line of treatment as well.He prescribed some genuine tests and guided on treatment options to be explored based on how the rest results look.
Overall ,he instilled confidence and belief in me that the issue has been identified and can be taken care off

tags: None
review: Dr. Rajeev is extremely sweet. He explained my injury calmly and patiently. I Highly recommend him.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review: He certainly knows what he is doing. He diagnosed my rib fracture instantly and explained me that I don’t need to do anything extra(like x-ray, MRI etc.). He advised me to take rest for 45 days and take extra care of the rib cage for sometime. I am writing this after 60 days and with all ribs intact!!

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review: Dr. Rajesh is very very effective in analyzing the root cause of pain. He is not like others who will ask to get X-Ray before looking in to the issue. He used his experience to find out root cause first. He explained the problem properly (I can go to the extend to say that he explained source of problem like some Professor until we understood). I strongly recommend Dr. Rajesh and HSR layout Appolo center and practo.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Wait time,Value for money,Treatment satisfaction,

Not all doctorsnow want to listen to patients now

Doc really took time to explain the issue, is very friendly in his way of communicating and felt very welcoming, polite and humble by nature.

My treatment is ongoing at the moment so cannot comment on the effectiveness of the treatment, will share that post the treatment finishes.

review: I have pain in left elbow for more than 5 months and have pain in left toe for around 2 months. Had all the blood tests done as per doctors recommendations.  Doctor prescribed me vit D sachets and calcium tablets. Not satisfied with the treatment. Doctor did not recommend any remedies to heal the pain, like wearing a toe seperator or considering physiotherapy etc (found it online myself later.) Just told me it was bad luck and I need to live with it. **** **** ** **** ****** ** *** *** ** ** ** *** *** **** *******. I am definitely consulting some other doctor.  Getting impatient with this much pain for so long. *** ** *** ***** ****** **** * ***** ****

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,
review:
Pros:
1. Dr. Rajeev is very friendly and approachable.
2. He is very attentive and patient while listening to the problem.
3. He explains the cause of issue in a simple way.
4. He always to try to treat the issue in natural methods rather than prescribing medicines or surgery straightaway.
5. He has prescribed pain killers for my shoulder swelling and advised that it would settle down itself which eventually did.

Cons:
1. I had to wait for more than an hour at the hospital for the doctor but later came to know that he has attended an emergency.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,
review:
We visited one month back to another doctor for my mother having pain in a knee and so she was unable to walk properly. That doctor even didn't physically inspected her knee and her pain only increased. 
So, we planned to visit to Dr Rajeev. He made us very comfortable & listen to her problems very carefully, inspected previous x-ray & physically inspected her knee and told us about valgus deformity. He suggested arch support and few muscle exercises to strengthen her muscle along with mild pain medicine. Honestly, we were very happy overall & definitely recommend him.
